info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 4 at 1:39PM MST until May 4 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, La Paz.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Maria River and Valencia Wash to Alamo Lake. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern La Paz County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
